What is New TEST Changed in AutoPIPE®

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.8(v<>:<>)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version <>.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME B31.3 2020 - Process Piping. This edition of B31.3 piping code mandates the use of ASME B31J for SIF and Flexibility calculations. A new option is now available in the Result Model Options that allows the use of ASME B31J Table 1.1 General Note (d) for sustained moment indices calculations. For branch connections, the use of effective section modulus (Ze) is now removed.
  • Reports
    • When importing an Aveva E3D pipe stress file, Tags (from Supports, Valves, and Flanges) and Attachment IDs (from Supports) are now supported.
    • Microsoft Word Report templates have been updated to improve overall quality.
  • General
    • A Model Explorer utility has been implemented to enable easier location of specific models. Search criteria and filter controls are also available.
    • The Tee Point dialog has been modified to automatically populate dynamic fields upon data entry.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Upgrade to Power Platform 17 to fix security vulnerability related to libxml2
      • A remote code execution vulnerability in libxml2 could enable an attacker using a specially crafted file to execute arbitrary code within the context of an unprivileged process. This issue is rated as High due to the possibility of remote code execution in an application that uses this library.

    • Update Newtonsoft to v13.0.1 to remove security vulnerability
      • Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions in Newtonsoft.Json. Newtonsoft.Json prior to version 13.0.1 is vulnerable to Insecure Defaults due to improper handling of StackOverFlow exception (SOE) whenever nested expressions are being processed. Exploiting this vulnerability results in Denial Of Service (DoS), and is exploitable when an attacker sends 5 requests that cause SOE in within 5 minutes. This vulnerability affects Internet Information Services (IIS) Applications.
  • Notes
    • Features related to the DGN file format removed in v12.07.00.346 have been reinstated.


AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.7 (v12.07.00.346:2021-12)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.07.00.346.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME B31.1 2020 - Power Piping. Improvements include the use of ASME B31J for component stress intensification factors (SIFs) and flexibility calculations by default, inclusion of axial force due to weight and resultant moment broken into in/out/torsional components with new SIFs for sustained and occasional stress calculations, axial force added with SIF set to 1.0 for bends/elbows/miters and resultant moment broken into in/out/torsional components with new SIFs for displacement stress range calculation, and report and option settings updated inline with these changes.
  • Reports
    • Added the ability to generate an Extended Components Report (.rpt) as a Quick Report only and display it in the Text Report Viewer.
    • Microsoft Word Input and Output reports are certified for commercial use.
  • Analysis
    • Slip/ultimate force/gap Supports can now be specified to simulate bi-linear stiffness.
    • Rotation Support gaps can now be specified in the clockwise/anti-clockwise direction.
    • The pendulum effect can now be applied to supports, including the ability to specify the Rod length and angulation. The pendulum effect is the behavior of an analytical element which is fixed for translations at one end but free for rotations (pivot point), and the other end is free to translate.
    • The number of supported Rotating Equipment (Turbine, Compressor, Pump, User-Defined) Nozzle points has been increased from 4 to 10.
  • General
    • AutoPIPE v12.7 models can now be saved back as v12.6 models.
  • Interoperability
    • AutoPIPE v12.7 is compatible with ProjectWise 365.
    • The PCF Translator now supports custom mapping of PCF attributes to AutoPIPE properties.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.
  • Notes
    • In the v12.7 release, some features related to the DGN file format including DGN export, iModel export, and iTwin Design Review are temporarily unavailable. This functionality will be made available in a future release. Please contact Bentley Technical Support if you have any questions.


AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.6 (v12.06.00.48:2021-05)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.06.00.48.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASCE 7 2016 - Minimum Design Loads and Associated Criteria for Buildings and Other Structures - Wind and Earthquake.
    • Added ISO 14692 2017 - Petroleum and Natural Gas Industries - Glass-Reinforced Plastic (GRP) piping system design.
    • Soil Overburden Loads and Seismic Wave data has been extended to B31.8 and B31.12 Pipelines codes.
  • Reports
    • A Pipe Connectivity Report has been added to the SQLite Report Manager standard Text Input reports to provide detailed information about node point locations and connectivity.
    • The SQLite Report Manager now lists available reports alphabetically for easier selection.
  • Analysis
    • Added the P Delta displacement (pendulum) effect on Rod Hangers. [Technology Preview ]
    • The setting of default analysis sets can now be defined to better control the resulting Code Combinations. Load case mapping has been added to cater to B31.3 and B31.1 occasional load calculations meeting 2018 requirements.
    • When using ASME B31.3 2010 or later, sustained stress is calculated as described in Code Case 178 to include torsion. This option (Result Model Options dialog) will now be disabled and checked when the 2010 or later edition of ASME B31.3 is selected.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

 [Technology Preview ]

Technology Previews provide users preliminary access to features currently in development but not yet ready for production. These features are provided at no additional charge to promote awareness of a feature or technology to be deployed in a future release. Users are encouraged to provide feedback and suggestions. To learn more about Technology Previews, please create a Service Request (be sure to include "Technology Preview" in the Description field).

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.5 (v12.05.00.16:2020-12)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version <>.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME BPVC Section III 2019 Rules for Construction of Nuclear Facility Components -Division 1 - Subsection NB - Class 1 Components.
    • Added ASME BPVC Section III 2019 Rules for Construction of Nuclear Facility Components -Division 1 - Subsection NC - Class 2 Components.
    • Added ASME BPVC Section III 2019 Rules for Construction of Nuclear Facility Components -Division 1 - Subsection ND - Class 3 Components.
    • Added ASME B31.12-2019 Edition Standard on Hydrogen Industrial Piping.
    • Added ASME B31.12-2019 Edition Standard on Hydrogen Pipelines.
  • Import/Export
    • Autodesk� Revit models can now be imported (using Fabrication-based components from a .PCF file).
    • Time History data can now be imported from an FRC file to generate AutoPIPE time history profiles and locations.
  • Interoperability
    • Implemented the iTwin Design Review Cloud Service to facilitate peer review of design work-in-progress deliverables.
  • Reports
    • Microsoft� Word� templates for Input Listing reports used by the SQLite Report Manager have been enhanced.
  • Library
    • The Material Library Editor has been enhanced to display charts facilitating the review and checking of material properties.
    • A check to verify the integrity of shipped material libraries and block the use of modified libraries has been implemented.
    • The Material Library now supports material library source files (.SRC) hosted on a network.
    • The Material Library Editor now enables you to quickly open a recently opened material library source file (.SRC).
  • Analysis
    • Support Optimizer Locator Groups now accommodate up to ten assemblies (increased from a maximum of five).
    • The Support Optimization Process Priority can now be defined. The Windows Operating System shares processor resources between all running processes based on priority. The higher the priority, the more processor resources are allocated to the process and potentially faster execution.
  • General
    • The Auto Flange/Bolt check-box (Flange tab of the Flange Check dialog) has been modified to include Gasket dimensions.
    • Soil Points visualization can now be toggled on and off. The soil point symbol displays on primary points and on all intermediate points.
    • The title bar and text color have been enhanced to improve visibility. Title bar text is now visible in minimized and maximized modes.
    • The model name now appears first in the title bar.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

 [Technology Preview ]

Technology Previews provide users preliminary access to features currently in development but not yet ready for production. These features are provided at no additional charge to promote awareness of a feature or technology to be deployed in a future release. Users are encouraged to provide feedback and suggestions. AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.4 (v12.04.00.13:2020-07)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.04.00.13.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added the 2017 edition of DNVGL-ST-F101 Submarine pipeline systems piping code (previously named DNV-OS-F101). Improvements include results options to assist with user control, Mill Pressure Factor k and a (mpt), updated bursting check, material properties, and added Ovality limit checks and compliancy notes.
  • Interoperability
    • AutoPIPE can now import CAESAR II 2019 neutral files.
    • The PCF Translator mapping file now includes item descriptions and support tags.
  • Library
    • The Library Editor interface has been redesigned to facilitate proper management of Material Library data.
  • General
    • Load combinations included in another stress-level combination are now highlighted in the code and non-code grids.
    • Reference points can now be added when inserting Anchors.
    • Global and local axes coordinate systems can now be toggled on and off.
    • The new Image Gallery tool enables the management of custom images associated with each model. These images can be easily incorporated into any AutoPIPE Microsoft� Excel� and Microsoft� Word� report.  [Technology Preview ]
    • Watermarks and Notes have been added to more clearly indicate Academic Licenses.
    • The Recent Models dialog now provides options to customize the models displayed - Pin, Un-pin, Remove from List, Remove all Un-pinned Items.
    • To improve the overall AutoPIPE experience, a feedback mechanism has been implemented providing the ability to comment on anything AutoPIPE-related.
    • AutoPIPE's interface now features a Black theme - the highest-contrast visual for your background.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

 [Technology Preview ]

Technology Previews provide users preliminary access to features currently in development but not yet ready for production. AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.3 (v12.03.00.17:2020-03)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.03.00.17.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added the 2018 edition of ASME B31.3 Process Piping. Major changes include Alternative Occasional Allowable calculations using Appendix V, Sustained and Occasional loads calculations using coincident operating conditions, updated weld strength reduction factors, and updated material library.
  • Reports
    • The SQLite Report Manager (located on the Tools Ribbon) now supports legacy text reports, custom Microsoft� Excel� reports, and custom Microsoft Word� reports. Legacy text and custom Microsoft� Excel� reports are now certified for commercial use.

      • Note: Microsoft Word� reports are a  [Technology Preview ]

    • Filter controls (i.e., Code Stresses, Displacement, Anchor, Support, Force and Moment) can now be applied directly to Output Quick Reports from within the Batch Report dialog.
  • Analysis
    • The Support Optimizer performance has been improved by employing multicore hardware and parallel evaluation of scenarios. This Select Entitlement Feature is now fully certified and is available for commercial use.

      • Note: Use of this feature is available to those with an active Select Subscription.

  • General
    • Added an Open Folder button to the Log Settings dialog to open the folder where log files are generated. Log files capture the success/failure of program operations and are a valuable tool for the Bentley Technical Support team to troubleshoot issues.
    • Added the Installation Test Set feature to launch the AutoPIPE Installation Test Set (ITS) to verify proper operation of the AutoPIPE program once it has been installed on a computer.
    • Rotating Equipment can now be inserted as a graphical symbol on a plot.
    • The License Configuration dialog has been improved to clarify all license options, including the Product Evaluation license.
    • An Ideas command has been added to the Help Ribbon, which launches the AutoPIPE Ideas area of Bentley Communities where you can submit and vote on ideas to improve AutoPIPE.
  • Interoperability
    • AutoPIPE models can now be exported to a Caesar 2016 (and later) model. This is a high-fidelity export of piping geometry, supports and load definitions directly to a Caesar C2 file without the need for a Cii neutral file.
    • Aveva E3D pipe stress files (.xml) containing pipeline geometry and properties can now be imported. [Technology Preview ]

  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

 [Technology Preview ]

Technology Previews provide users preliminary access to features currently in development but not yet ready for production. These features are provided at no additional charge to promote awareness of a feature or technology to be deployed in a future release. Users are encouraged to provide feedback and suggestions. AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.2 (v12.02.00.14:2019-10)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.02.00.14.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added BS EN 13480-3:2017 for design criteria and stress calculation of industrial metallic piping systems, including supports.
  • Reports
    • SQLite Input and Output reports are now certified for commercial use and employ improved dialogs, a progress bar, and maintain a standard and consistent text format.
    • SQLite Input Listing reports have been improved to include more model coverage, printed in tabular format: Cut Short, Out-of-Roundness, Additional Weight, Hydrodynamic Data, User Weld Factor, Nozzle, Flexible Joint, and Anchor.
    • The SQLite Report Manager is now certified for commercial use with the added ability to generate reports in Microsoft� Excel� and standard text format.
    • The Time History Output report can now be filtered to remove very small numeric values (which are of no practical importance).
  • Analysis
    • An option has been added to define and analyze gross discontinuity stress using a standard, more conservative method. With this method, a single value of gross discontinuity stress can be entered at a node point for each thermal case.
    • The Support Optimization feature, used to identify optimal support solutions, is now available for testing to all users. [Technology Preview ] 
    • Corrosion allowance is now available for Flange Analysis.
  • General
    • A logging mechanism has been added to capture the success/failure of program operations. This log file is a valuable tool for the Bentley Technical Support team to troubleshoot issues.
    • The Open Recent Models dialog has been improved to expand the number of recently used models, show a preview of a selected model, and display relevant file details.
  • Documentation
    • A Supplemental Documentation button has been added to the Help ribbon to access a set of Supplemental White Papers, How To Procedures, Tutorials, and Reference Information documents in PDF format within the main program help.
    • Non-linear Analysis diagrams and associated program documentation have been improved.
  • Interoperability
    • Models can now be exported to a CAESAR II C2 file (compatible with CAESAR 2016 and higher). This eliminates the extra step of importing a CAESAR II neutral file and provides for more fidelity. B31.1 and B31.3 Piping Codes are also supported.  [Technology Preview ] 
    • The PCF Translator has been enhanced with a new user interface and context-sensitive help to improve the user experience and workflow.
  • Isometrics
    • Isometric drawings have been improved to include updated support symbols for better visibility.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

 [Technology Preview ]

Technology Previews provide users preliminary access to features currently in development but not yet ready for production. These features are provided at no additional charge to promote awareness of a feature or technology to be deployed in a future release. Users are encouraged to provide feedback and suggestions. To learn more about Technology Previews, please create a Service Request (be sure to include "Technology Preview" in the Description field).

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.1 (v12.01.00.09:2019-5)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.01.00.09.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME B31.1 2018 code including updated material library (reference standard, table number, group number), composition information for code materials, and E factor.
  • Analysis
    • Updated Upheaval Buckling analysis and reporting.
    • Enhanced Support Optimization functionality to include minimum frequency design criteria, seed solution, and improved consistency checks . [Technology Preview ] 
    • Improvements in Flange Analysis including enhanced display and filter operations; automatic update of flange, bolt hole diameter, hub length, and gasket dimensional properties; and automatic selection of the flange/bolt dimensions library based on the nominal pipe size and length.
  • Reports
    • AutoPIPE Report Manager now includes a feature to generate traditional text reports with custom ordering and selection. [Technology Preview ] 
    • All input and batch output reports applicable to the current model will be exported to SQLite database regardless of the selection on the input listing or batch output report dialogs.
  • Interoperability
    • Improved PCF Translator to include more descriptive and accessible conversion logs, easier selection of multiple files for batch conversion, and importing closed loops.
  • Isometrics
    • Improved integration with OpenPlant Isometrics Manager CONNECT Edition.
    • Improved Isometrics generation including better control over settings, customization, and auto-split functions.
    • Improved font sizes, line weights, support symbols, and scaling.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12 (v12.00.00.14:2018-12)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 12.00.00.14
  • General
    • CONNECT Licensing
      This product version utilizes CONNECT Licensing, which is not supported by SELECT activation key(s). CONNECT Licensing features new behavior to enhance your organization's user administration and security with mandatory user sign-in via CONNECTION Client to access the application. If you are already signed in to the CONNECTION Client, you have met this prerequisite. If you have not, please refer to the Administrator's Resource Center and/or contact your administrator for assistance in the registration and sign-in process.
    • Increased the number of entries listed in the recent model list for a better user experience.
    • Support/Reference IDs are now auto-generated and read-only for better tracking of supports.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME BPVC Section III 2017 code for the construction of Nuclear Facility Components.
  • Analysis
    • Added Upheaval Buckling Analysis to perform a simplified buckling analysis based on idealized pipeline imperfections in long buried pipelines. [Technology Preview ] 
    • Added the NodeLink feature to allow a node to be connected to another piping node. This allows for the release of connectivity in a specific direction to be utilized in hanger selection where an Anchor is not present.
    • Anchors can now be defined as connected to a structure node to allow the anchor load to be resolved into the structure.
    • Added Support Optimization to determine optimal support locations and options based on criteria such as supporting structure loads, allowable displacements, and support costs.  [Technology Preview ] 
  • Reports
    • Added a Select All option on the result grid to conveniently select/un-select all combinations at one time.
    • Input and output reports1 are now available in the SQLite DB format. Post-processing, review, and print functions are now possible in third-party applications and report generators.  
    • Stress reports have been improved when utilizing DNV-OS-F101 by changing the title "Comb. stress category" to "Load Control Limit Check".
  • Import
    • Added an option to import E3d (*.pcf) files via the PCF Translator.
  • Interoperability
    • Two-way interoperability between SACS and AutoPIPE has been improved, including change management by using Structural Synchronizer (aka ISM). [Technology Preview ] 
    • Integration with OpenPlant Isometrics Manager CONNECT Edition has been implemented for stress isometrics.
    • Hidden segments in a model are no longer exported to isometric drawings in OpenPlant Isometric Manager.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

1 The Version 6.1 Point Data Listing, Extended Component Data Listing, Flange Analysis Report, and Thermal Transient Analysis Report are not available in the SQLite DB format. This feature will be made available in a future release.

 [Technology Preview ]

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.4 (v11.04.00.10:2018-07)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.4.
  • Analysis
    • Flange Analysis
      • The allowable value for flange allowable stresses is now determined by the attached piping materials / piping code.
      • A warning is now issued when the calculated Bsc exceeds 1 and is not included in calculations.
      • An option has been added to substitute "B1" for the inside diameter of flange "B".
      • The flange analysis workflow has been updated to perform automatic ANSI checks for all flanges in the model.
      • External flange loads are now included in determining bolt stresses.
  • Library
    • The Vendor Valve catalogs are now certified for commercial consumption.
  • General
    • CONNECT Advisor is now fully integrated, including Contextual assistance, Expert Advisor, and the Ribbon command search utility.
  • Reports
    • A new check has been implemented to verify the selection of points before running a report that limits results to selected node points.
    • Export SQLite DB Input and Output Reports  [Technology Preview ] 
      • Users now have more power to create data reports with the information that is important to their teams with the new SQLite DB export capability and a custom report manager.
    • AutoPIPE Report Manager  [Technology Preview ] 
      • The query designer can be used to export custom reports to Excel with charts and pivot tables.
      • Detailed hanger listing reports can be generated to assist in the purchase and installation of piping supports.
  • Interoperability
    • Stress Isometrics with Open Plant Isometrics Manager (OPIM)
      • Separate support and anchor tags are now available to control the information to print on isometrics.
      • The default acronym for non-standard Pipe has been changed to avoid confusion with Nominal Pipe Size.
    • Read/write controls have been added to Integrated Structural Model (ISM) for better integration with Structural Analysis and Plant Design products.  [Technology Preview ] 
    • All Piping Codes and Material Libraries have been added to the PCF Translator.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.
 [Technology Preview ]

Technology Previews provide users preliminary access to features currently in development but not yet ready for production. These features are provided at no additional charge to promote awareness of a feature or technology to be deployed in a future release. Users are encouraged to provide feedback and suggestions. AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.3 (v11.03.00.08:2018-04)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.3.
  • General
    • The Pressure Temperature grid now provides an option to display Delta T1 and Delta T2 only, facilitating easier review and updates for Nuclear users.
    • Links have been added to the Ribbon for quick access to the End User License Agreement (EULA) and the Bentley Legal Notice.
    • Rotating Equipment commands have been relocated to the Results tab on the Ribbon for better access.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME B31J for more accurate calculations of stress intensification factors and flexibility factors of ASME B31 codes. This code is currently available for ASME B31.1 and B31.3 for code years 2012 and later.
  • Library
    • Source files are now released for users to customize material libraries.
  • Reports
    • The support data listing now includes support data for all supports, regardless if they are connected to pipe or a structure.
    • Export SQLite DB input & output reports  [Technology Preview ] 
      • Users now have more power to create data reports with the information that is important to their teams with the new SQLite DB export capability and a custom report manager
    • AutoPIPE Report Manager[Technology Preview ] 
      • Use the query designer to create custom reports to excel with charts and pivot tables.
      • Generates detailed hanger listing reports to help purchase and installation of pipe support.
      • MS Word Report Writer now covers more reports and includes templates with screenshots.
  • Isometrics
    • Users can now customize the printing of elevations on drawings by using a script.
    • Users can now customize the direction and location of the north arrow on drawings by using a script.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.2.

    • Wind loads on structural members can be defined for more accurate results.
    • Limits on Time History Profile input data have been extended.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME NB: Coincident Pressure Option for Levels B, C and D.
  • Reports
    • The Hydrotest Pressure report is now available in the Model Input Listing.
  • Isometrics
    • The breakpoint logic for splitting drawings has been improved.
  • Import/Export
    • CAESAR 2018 (v10) models can now be imported.
    • An option to review and reset component and material mappings has been added.
    • Updated the Pipelink interface with STAAD CONNECT Edition (based on the SQLite database format).
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.1 (v11.01.00.23:2017-09)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.1.
  • General
    • CONNECT Advisor is now included to help provide easier access to Bentley LEARN materials and other training content.
    • Fluid Transient data can now be deleted from the model database.
    • Gravitational Constant and Water Density values can be edited (within the AutoPIPE.INI configuration file) for more accurate results.
    • The "Suppress Analysis Warning Prompts" option has been moved to the Analyze All dialog.
    • All segments in a model can be reordered based on a pre-defined ordering algorithm. This algorithm detects disconnected groups of segments in order, orders the header first and then each branch in order as it encompasses it.
    • Up to 30 user toolbars can now be created.
    • CONNECTed users now receive program update notifications and can download and install in a single step.
  • Analysis
    • Wind loads on structural members can be defined for more accurate results. [Technology Preview ] 
    • More memory has been allocated to support Time History analysis for more complicated models.
    • Reinforcement requirements for ASME B31.8 are now checked for improved Tee results.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME B31.1 2016 edition.
    • Added ASME B31.3 2016 edition.
    • Added ASME B31.8 2016 edition.
    • Updated ASME B31J to 2017 edition.[Technology Preview ] 
  • Library
    • Added SA-508 materials to ASME2013.
  • Reports
    • The Preliminary Stress Report has been changed to Pre-Verification Stress Report in the Batch Report dialog.
    • The Damping Ratio has been added to the Analysis Summary Report/Harmonic Load Cases to provide easier access to data needed for quality assurance of models.
    • ASME NB stress summary reports now list the loadset pair generating the maximum stress ratio for each stress equation at each piping point.
  • Documentation
    • To ensure clarity of calculations, a note has been added highlighting that actual component dimensions are used for stress indices calculations in ASME NB.
    • Information has been added regarding the use of reinforced branch thickness for Branch connection B2r calculations for ASME NC/ND calculations.
    • The Use Nominal Thickness help topic has been improved by adding definitions for corroded and reduced wall thickness and usage.
    • A note has been added to the Load Summary Data Listing for the automated ASCE 7 Wind Cf calculation.
  • Modeling
    • When renumbering or renaming a point, the point is now renamed inside the Reference Point Reference ID.
    • To facilitate accuracy in model construction, a model consistency/design check has been added when the stiffness value for a support is set to zero.
  • Isometrics
    • To facilitate productivity, batch processing is introduced for isometrics generation.
  • Import/Export
    • Exported .imodel files are now compatible with Navigator CONNECT Edition.
    • Pipelink files are now compatible with STAAD CONNECT Edition (sqlite database).
  • PCF Translator
    • Program now automatically detects and displays a dialog to help map all un-mapped components in the PCF file.
    • Flanges are now mapped to a RIGID pipe with a point flange.
  • Security Release Notes
    • Not applicable to this release.
 [Technology Preview ]

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.0.0 (v11.00.00.22:2017-02)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 11.0.0.
  • General
    • New Ribbon interface with customizable and docking toolbars.
    • CONNECT Project Configuration Settings to help ensure all users on a CONNECT project are using the correct design settings.
    • North Arrow directional settings are now saved with the model.
    • Software validation certificate is included with the installation.
    • Option to save a version 10.0 DAT file from version 11.0.
    • Option to ignore the build number upon opening a newer model.
  • Analysis
    • Added B31J SIF and K factor calculations for ASME B31.1 and B31.3 (2012 and later). [Technology Preview ] 
    • Added option to enter Maximum and Minimum Gross Discontinuity Stress values per thermal case for nuclear piping design.
    • Updated Gross Discontinuity Stress calculation to range from ambient temperature when calculating Max/Min stress values for ASME NB.
    • Improved Ratchet Stress Range calculation for nuclear piping design to reduce conservatism.
  • Piping Codes
    • Added ASME BPVC Section III (NB, NC, ND) 2015 code edition.
    • Added ASME B31.4-2016 code edition.
    • Added DSs Primary stress category for JSME 2008 (class 2).
    • Added Torsional SIF to tee type 'Other' for ASME B31.3 2012 and later editions.
  • Libraries
    • Bentley Content Services valve catalog integration for AutoPIPE is now available as a local cache of databases.
    • Added additional B31.1-2014 materials.
  • Documentation
    • Help content expanded explanation of Moment/Stress level code combinations with specific examples.
    • Help content expanded explanation of C2r and C2b calculation equations for ASME NC/ND.
  • Reports
    • AutoPIPE Report Manager now includes pivot tables and charts.. [Technology Preview ] 
    • MS Word Report Writer now includes templates with screenshots. [Technology Preview ] 
    • MS Word Report Writer now includes both input and output reports. [Technology Preview ] 
    • AutoPIPE Report Manager now generates detailed hanger listing reports to help purchase and installation of pipe support. [Technology Preview ] 
    • General Stress Table from the output report is now available in the Results Grid.
    • General Stress Table from the output report is now available in the Results Database.
    • SQLite Database export has been expanded to include more reports. [Technology Preview ] 
    • ISO 14692 Report improvements for better results viewing.
  • Isometrics
    • Added an Automatic Split option based on the line number for stress isometric creation.
    • Added better white space management for stress isometric creation.
  • PCF Translator
    • Option to convert a left hand coordinate system to a right hand coordinate system.
    • Apply a guide when a support item description contains the word u-bolt.
    • Option to add/ignore anchors at free ends.
    • Support for two endpoint supports when importing a PCF file.
    • User interface to help map unmapped PCF components.
    • User interface to help map PCF materials to available materials in AutoPIPE.
    • User interface to help define default values for different support types.
    • Option to ignore importing schedule for fittings and use the pipe schedule.
    • Support for importing descriptive tags for valves, flanges and supports.
    • Conversion of PCF flange length to a RIGID pipe.
    • Mapping of strainers to valves.
    • Mapping of angle valves to two valves connected at an angle.
    • Pipe identifier naming convention updated to clearly represent size.

These features are provided at no additional charge to promote awareness of a feature or technology to be deployed in a future release. Users are encouraged to provide feedback and suggestions. AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 10.1.0 (v10.01.00.08:2016-04)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 10.1.0.
  • Reporting
    • Report Integration Method used for Time History under Load Summary Data Listing
  • Import/Export
    • PXF Import: Increase length of PXF material name to 50 characters to improve interoperability with plant design programs i.e. OpenPlant Modeler and AutoPLANT
  • Modeling
    • Model consistency check added to warn user when Beam Modulus = 0.00
    • Model consistency check added to warn user when zero values are set for fields in Pipe Properties dialog
  • General
    • Users are now prevented from opening DAT model files last updated using newer program versions in order to prevent file corruption
  • Documentation
    • CONNECT overview documentation is now more visible in the program and Help content
    • Help content has been update to better explain the current velocity extrapolation
  • Installer
    • Installer now clearly identifies that the software will upgrade from a previous version

AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 10.0.0 (v10.00.00.10:2015-10)

The following outline identifies new features and enhancements in the AutoPIPE CONNECT Edition version 10.0.0.
  • Piping Codes
    • ASME B31.3 2014 now available
    • ASME B31.8 2014 Edition (Onshore and Offshore) now available
    • ASME B31.4 Offshore 2012 Edition now available
    • CSA-Z662 2011 Edition (including Offshore) now available
    • CSA-Z662 2015 Edition (including Offshore) now available
    • Apply ASME CC N755-1 rules to B31.4 Onshore and B31.8 Onshore
      • HDPE is becoming more popular in many industries and these code allowables will help you take advantage of HDPE in more scenarios
    • Seven new materials added to the ASME 2013 material library
  • Analysis
    • Local Incidental Pressure Calculation (used for offshore riser piping) available for all piping codes
      • These calculations originate from DNV-OS-F101 to take into account the rise in pressure due to fluid in a riser pipe
    • Option to apply pressure correction factor to user-defined SIF and Flexibility factor values
      • ASME B31 codes take into account pressure stiffening which reduces flexibility factor and SIF's value
    • Apply ASME CC N755-1 rules to B31.4 Onshore and B31.8 Onshore
      • HDPE is becoming more popular in many industries and these code allowables will help you take advantage of HDPE in more scenarios
    • ASME NB: Use local tee axis for tee moment summation for ASME III Class 1 piping
      • Option for a less conservative method for summing moments at a tee gives users more options for their designs
    • Report inconsistent non-linear code and non-code combinations to ensure proper pipe stress analysis
      • Automatic checking of non-linear combinations will help users to ensure proper pipe stress analysis
    • User SIF note added to Flange, Tee, and Valve Data Listing sub-report for added visibility
  • Import/Export
    • AutoPIPE Isometrics Manager can now export angle valves, base elbow supports, and reference items
    • XML export to be imported to plant design software like PDMS
    • Export SQLite DB input & output reports [Technology Preview ] 
      • Users now have more power to create data reports with the information that is important to their teams with the new SQLite DB export capability and a custom report manager
  • Modeling
    • Automatic syncing of node and support IDs for increased model organization
      • For improved model organization and visibility of critical points in your stress model
  • General
    • Bentley CONNECT Project Selection dialog added for increased workflow visibility for your entire project team
      • For increased workflow visibility for your entire project team
    • Unchecking the "Show rotation report" check-box will be retained for the entire AutoPIPE session
      • To avoid unwanted extra clicking
    • Improved workspace and user profile management per Windows guidelines
    • Automatic syncing of node and support IDs for increased model organization
      • For improved model organization and visibility of critical points in your stress model
    • Results Database are now compatible with Office 2013
      • Compatibility with latest Microsoft Office software will ensure your integration is seamless
    • Warning message for pipes using the ADLPipe default fatigue curve that have a 1E6 cycle limit
      • Curves only have data to 1E6, so a warning noting that AutoPIPE is interpolating beyond the published data will keep users aware of their design assumptions
    • Warning message added to ASME B31.4 (2012) to display when selected material does not have yield strength values
    • Microsoft Word Input Data Listing for expanded options for model reporting [Technology Preview] 
  • Documentation
    • Improved help content for DNV 2012 legacy combinations and usage
    • Updated ASME BPV-III-1-NB (1972-2013) flow chart in help
    • Added help content for CSA-Z662 Thermal Expansion with effects of "Include axial force"
    • Migrated tutorial PDFs from Documents directory to embedded within main AutoPIPE Help File (refer to Documents\Tutorial Files Notification.pdf for full details)
